alert.note: Alert for Bradford; Union; Western Clay (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 08 at 6:28PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Bradford, east central Union and northwestern Clay Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 628 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout near Raiford, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds around 40 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Middleburg, Camp Blanding, Lawtey and Asbury Lake. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
